column5: Don't need a crystal ball to know how that'd go.  They'd only get the one invitation.
That, right there, warrants a severe beating !!

I must admit I got a 'little miffed' when a buddy and I were trolling with an elec in a canoe and he ran over my line so many times that (a) I ran out of line and ( the motor quit so we(he, actually, in the stern) had to paddle!!!!

Heres one that has led to a fight on my boat..  Buddy is sitting there, defeated, no longer fishing. I whip a senko into a tree and miss a big fish. Before I can get my bait back in I see his senko going right into the spot I just missed the fish.  Grrrrrrr

Why would you get pissed at that?  Guy hasn't caught a fish all day, unless you guys were in some sort of $100,000 big fish contest, lol.  If I'm having a good day with a few in the boat and my oldman hasn't hooked up yet I'll tell him exactly where to cast if I just missed a fish.
We WERE in a derby, every man for himself!!
exactly, i like seeing guests or others catch a fish, for me, its a chance to learn
See above.
You should have thrown him overboard, lol!
but not before tying the anchor to his ankles!!
That explains why he did it, now doesn't it? "Every man for himself"...
Also explains why I cracked him in the jaw, lmao
How about opening up a couple of bales of hay, up stream, the night before opening day... floats and hay, what an entertaining combination! HH
Call Solo a pinner. HAHAHAHA
Funny I would have to say this to a moderator, but take it to PM's. We don't need a fun thread locked due to a disagreement.
Because I'm a moderator, I shouldn't have an opinion? I offered some free waypoints. Some good ones too.
I've been up north fishing all week, how'd I get involved in this  ??
We all love ya Lew. You're an easy target.

I hear both sides of this story and understand them, but what's done is done.  You should be a well enough angler that you don't need 'secret spots' as a crutch to catch fish.  But it sure ain't the right thing to do, for anyone, EVER - to give away spots you worked to find.  Unless of course they paid you for it.
At least he grouped you with a great bunch of guys Lew!! lol

DanC, was it you that gave the info for a price, or a local guide?  I still don't see the big deal. I've put lots of people on spots, and they couldn't catch fish. It takes more. Than a spot to catch 'em! Experience will always out produce paid for, or internet information.  S.

can't help but agree with danc. all you southern guys piss and moan if someone doesn't blur backgrounds etc but it's ok to come up north and crap where we eat?  i think not.  with very little research and exploration i was onto fish in the nipigon river system.  no need to make it easy for people.
Whats he saying????????? MINE,MINE MINE. HAHAHAHAHAHA
Hey hey hey,watch yer manners there bye. LMAO
Using a bobber( OK FLOAT, if you insist) is like using training wheels on a bike.   Alright---I'm leaving now, be back later, maybe much later!
Ya those bait fishers sure hate it when you call their float a bobber.
I've got the best looking bobbers ever!   :)
This post is too funny.
"It's my legal right!" Is usually followed by a verbal or physical fight on the shorelines.
"I thought you put the drain plug in"!  .. or in the case of the Temagami OPP on the Friday of the May 24 weekend... "I had no idea there was three plugs in a Stanley".
Do you think this verticle hold makes my 44" ski caught on may 15th look like a 50"?
Way to go Lew !!!!!
Something about putting a finger in your dogs ear  ..........Well it worked once before,,,,,,,
"Im putting them all back, its just for fun"
Ya I'll get the net, just let me finish texting !
"I've got no problem paying for gas and minnows, but ill have to pay you back later, i forgot my wallet". 2 hours into the road trip.
Let him out of the car...he most likely left his fishing permit (ID) in his wallet.

No doubt Roy. Another bad scenario I've encountered is having a well planned family/friend camping trip, only to have a guest bring enough food for a day or two, but enough booze to warrant an extra boat trip. Grrrrr....
I like to use musky meat for bait while cat fishing
Do a guided Brook Trout trip on the Nipigon and then send all your buddies there with your new found knowledge.
HAHAHAHAHAHAHA!
I wish that I could laugh at this Roy, but it did happen right here on OFC. I had a nasty pm exchange with the OP, but apparently he didn't get it.
Yup wouldn't want anyone else to experience catching a world class brook trout now would we, its reserved exclusively for DanC  Give me a break....
Glad you found this. It's not going to be world class for long if everyone does what you did. Are friends of your friends of your friends heading up there this year with your paid for knowledge?
Actually the friends of my friends of my friends of my friends are... But that's okay right because you don't even fish there, you have much better spots.

I do have better spots for sure. You are fishing in an aquarium (between two hydro dams) of perhaps the best trophy Brook Trout reproduction waters on the planet. Have fun and make sure you bring a bunch more people next year. Your paid for knowledge is gonna win you a bunch of new friends. I spent 30 years learning this system and you're giving it all away for a few hundred bucks spent. Nice.

It isn't about winning new friends. People have given me knowledge on different areas before which has improved how well I did that, so I thought I would return the favour to someone else. Lots of people on this forum take but never give, I was trying not to be one of them. I was unaware that helping out one group that was going there anyways was so terrible.
Let's add spot burners to the list.

If guides are willing to take people out for money to their best spots. They are willing to have those spots taken from them for that amount. Is that not what a guide is for after all? To show off the area and make others good fishermen as well?  cheers.
Then go back the next day and fish all his spots before he gets there.  Then post the pics to look like a hero.
I find it ironic that this thread started a fish fight.

Not what I've seen for the most part...  Usually people hire a guide to learn how to fish different techniques... Learn what kind of spots/structure hold fish.... What lures work well on certain water bodies... Sometimes it's a rookie looking to fast track the learning curve of difficult fish.... Or even someone that fishes one specie and doesn't want to spend the time to learn another...  I did have 1 client openly admit to me a week after we did a trip that he booked me to find spots... And after our trip he spent 2 days trying to find my spots and catch on them with almost 0 success.... But he did say he started catching a lot more fish on spots he already knew before... This was a local angler that is retired and I have yet to see him at all... Let alone on "my" spots...  Just what I've seen so far...
LMAO
Well, it started out fun. Thanks guys[/sarcasm]
Start a thread about fishing fights on OFC seems to be one that works.

The Nipigon river is without a doubt the most well known spot on the planet for big brook trout. There's been multiple television shows filmed there as well as countless magazine articles written, some with detailed maps of hotspots included.  I fail to see how a post on a fishing forum is that big of a deal.  On the other hand I have a very good friend who lives in Thunder Bay (ironically enough also named Dan LOL!) who fishes brookies exclusively on the big lake.  I can tell you he's not very happy with the recent surge of online reports outlining precisely where guys are fishing. It's a huge sore point with him and I can understand why.

Uh oh, Danc has company on the Nipigon.......call the whaaaambulance!! Secrets out!!  Try living around here man! You'd cry a river if you had to deal with the Bull around here. It happens everywhere....  S.
On this board, saying anything other than "Way to go Lew!" will pretty much do it. Jim PS - you can substitute Lew with Wayne, Terry, Big Cliff, etc. etc.

No thanks. I couldn't live anywhere near there. My point is this. The guy I called out has "steelheader" tagged to his name. Aren't "steelheaders" the whiniest people on the planet about giving up locations? Yet they can come to my neck of the woods, pay for knowledge and information, and then give it all away freely? How about if I hired a guide and did some steelhead fishing down there and then sent all my buddies to his honey holes? Do you think he'd be ok with that? I could make $1000.00 bucks a weekend guiding.Tax free. I've been offered that and more. But I won't sell my locations. That's how important this fishery is to me. But if you want free info, you know who to ask.
lol ...the irony...      You could post only if you have nothing good to say.....ie...

It seems that you're as whiny as any steelhead angler. I've noticed in the past that you see pike as garbage fish and Brookie's as the chosen fish. Just curious would you care at all if people posted Pike spots from your neck of the woods? My guess is no.
I just find it ironic that you're so protective of your preferred fish and fishing area, but could care less about other people's preferred fish and where hey are.

Pike are everywhere up here. Come and get em. Nipigon Brook Trout are like no other place on the planet. They deserve some respect. If you want some 40"+ waypoints for pike, pm me. Nobody targets Pike here. They are the last thing that you want to see on the end of your line up here. I can catch a 36" Pike a 3 minute drive from my house. Guaranteed. But why would I? They stink. They almost always swallow your offering. No good to eat. And I catch way too many of them.
Like this???
This would almost be gospel in Nova Scotia, cept down there it's trout, Atlantics and stripers.
When your buddy who hasn't even grasped how to properly hold a baitcaster (nvm casting) says "I'm SO ready for bigtime bass tournaments." With all seriousness on his face. Richard SMASH.
Drives me insane..  Put your boat in or out and get the hell out of the way..
Go salmon fishing during the peak of the run, Burt Dam will yield the best results
I suggest showing up in full SWAT gear to protect yourself from the flying hooks/sinkers/whatever.
if you don't use a flasher, you're not doing it right.
What the %^*%@#%(Q@&^_#*)(^@*(%_P are you talking about you &_*(&&%^&& offspring of a *^#)Q#^)Q&+_$! Have you no idea that a fishfinder is the evolution of a flasher??
I just have to tell my wife we need a sitter so I can go fishing.... Always ends up in a fishing fight at our house......

Online "Hey guys, Lake Sturgeon are junk fish right? I hope so because I just threw 7 of them up on shore"  For me, on the water its when I'm on my buddies dock on Quinte, its obvious he doesn't have a boat and we are landlocked, and yet someone comes by and tries to cast into our back pocket.
If you hold pike and musky up by the eyes before you release them you won't get your fingers cut!       For all you guests on this website looking for tips...I'M JOKING!!
LOL and

Posting GPS waypoints or a pic where somebody recognizes the background Pickereye Tiller vs console (There really is no debate, tiller rules, but for some reason it still causes heated discussion. But ask me again in December when the boat spray has frozen to my forehead again)  The boat launch antics have to be my biggest pet peeve too... it's one thing if they are new at it and have some difficulties but it's another when the experienced guys take their sweet time doing stuff that should be done away from the launch! You can tie on lures LATER!!!!!
I like console, ever driven a high performance boat? lots of fun. but ya tiller is probs better for fishing/trolling, plus more room for fishing stuff
for me, probs when I caught a seagull (ON ACCIDENT) and some old guy started screaming at me lol
Anyone want to go Sturgon fishing?
would love to, on the fraser river
no no theres lots at the mouth of the Notty.......
Caught it on a marshmallow!!
Saying you have too much roe from snagged salmon and offering it to fellow members.
How to start a fishing fight ... set the hook!
Hypocrites.... Don't tell me not to do something when your doing it worse/more then me...
When the fish is brought up ass first to the bank, this helps loosen the eggs...  come on man!
CORMORANTS!
I'm betting it's a question like "Does anyone have any good recipes for muskie?" But I might be wrong...
Post to online fishing forum while drinking.
Have an opinion...  Michael
Starting threads like this one will probably do it...it won't last long.

Claim that the specie (s) that you fish for are superior to all others. Example: I'm a trout and walleye fisherman. If I posted on a fishing forum that bass, pike and muskie are garbage fish compared to my preferred species, well... needless to say, I'd get cut up by other members.

Does anyone have a remedy for musky farts in a dog?  I boil and grind up all the musky I catch and feed it to my dogs, they love it but boy to those farts stink.  Any help for this problem will be greatly appreciated.    Thanks in advance, Steve
Lmao
I'd hardly call online disputes of any sort a "fight" ..  unless most fights are completely imaginary and unimportant..?
I once hit someone in the face with a sucker. There is nothing more insulting than being slapped with a coarse fish.
How did you know? Oh, my avatar. Gotcha.
That's about as accurate a description as I've heard. Handbags at 10 paces… and I've participated in my share of them.

Having said that ^. Making absolute statements will often cause vigorous responses.  It's one thing to say you prefer a certain type of fishing, fish, boat, motor or configuration, but to say that there is only one "best" and that all others are inferior is unwise, at least.  My dad would often say (we did disagree a lot) that the world would be an awfully boring place if we all had the same opinion.
Look to the guy beside you, no matter how close they are and say "I was here first".
Call that early season brown trout you caught an Atlantic.
cheer for a team other than the make beleafs.
Forgot about that one. Just might be the fastest.
I get way better control with my tiller motor.
5 nickles in my freezer bassholes!!  Wanna come over and see my Muskie mount, then watch the sens beat the laffs and eat some bass?
Stare too long at the guys bikini clad girlfriend  as you troll by their boat.    Although, I only got mooned for doing that, lol - which I really wasn't, I was trolling!
But which one of them mooned you? Inquiring minds want to know.
I find ground muskie, walleye, and bass make great fertilizer for my garden.  But only when they are full of roe.
Winner  lol

When the guy in the front of the boat cast everywhere and leaves you with nothing except behind the boat.... Grrrrrrrr. Then complains that he cant get close enough to where he wants to cast. Oh ya that started more than a few battles.
Strap down your boat right on the launch grrr
Atlantic!
